text: - Open mouth - Ophthalmoplegia - Photosensitive tonic-clonic seizures - Sleep disturbance - Slender finger - Truncal ataxia - Urinary incontinence - X-linked dominant inheritance - The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) has collected information on how often a sign or symptom occurs in a condition. Much of this information comes from Orphanet, a European rare disease database. The frequency of a sign or symptom is usually listed as a rough estimate of the percentage of patients who have that feature
